You couldn’t believe your grand opening was finally happening!

After all of the months of work, and all of the shit you had gone through to get there, it was finally time to open your business to the public. Your paintings and creations were placed around the entire building, as art aficionados and those in the business walked around, taking it all in while enjoying a flute of champagne.

Harry looked to where you were standing in front of one of your pieces, discussing it with another artist. He was so proud of you, documenting it for you as he took photos of the event. He planned to advertise your business on his social media soon, but not wanting to create a frenzy at the grand opening, he chose to wait until after everyone left, wanting a photo of the two of you in front of one of your creations.

“Are you having a good time, love?” Harry smiled as he placed his arm around your waist.

“Such a great time!” you beamed, more happy than you could remember being in a long time. “A lot of people showed up, didn’t they?”

“It’s been ass to ass in here since we opened the door!” Harry laughed as you smiled and giggled. “There are people all over the pavement outside and cars congested in the street. It’s amazing!”

You smiled, accepting his kiss to your cheek, then walked away with someone who had a question. Harry watched around the building, speaking with those he knew, always training his eye to follow where you were. As he glanced toward the door, Harry felt his stomach drop, as he noticed Michael, making his way to where you were in the next room.

Harry quickly walked through a different doorway, seeing where you were, and barging his way through the crowd of people, barely getting to you before Michael did. You felt  a quick grab of your arm, spinning you slightly, as you looked at Harry questioningly.

“Everything all right?” you asked, seeing the look on his face, then hearing what he was looking at and turning.

“I didn’t get my invitation to your grand opening, sweetheart,” Michael said with a smile. “You promised me an invitation the day we met and you bought this building from me.”

Your heart sped, feeling as if it were in your throat, looking around at the hundreds of guests unaware of the imminent scene that could easily happen.

“You aren’t welcome here,” Harry told Michael quietly, trying not to bring attention, as Harry signaled to the security he had waiting nearby. Michael turned and saw the large men in black clothing coming closer to where they were.

“Please, I’m not here to cause trouble,” Michael said with earnest inflection. “I only wanted to come congratulate you for all of your hard work and dedication. This is amazing, sweetheart!”

Michael felt the hands of the guards on his arms.

“I’m sorry,” Michael said. “I’ll go. I’m not one for large crowds anyway. I just wanted you to know I am supporting you in this, and I wish you nothing but the best.”

You didn’t acknowledge anything he said to you, merely looked down facing Harry, as he slipped his arm around you, leading you away from where Michael and the guards were walking away. Guiding you into a small area in the back, Harry cupped his hand around your jaw, feeling you trembling slightly.

“You all right, love?” he asked quietly in case there were others around who could hear. He saw you nod your head then look up at him.

“Yeah,” you nodded. “Yeah, I’m…I’m okay. Thanks.”

Taking a deep breath, you accepted the long hug from your best friend. The comfort you felt when Harry held you was like no other sense of security and gentleness you had known. It made you wish you could stay in his arms all the time, missing what you once had with him. Pulling slowly away from him, you grinned lovingly to him, feeling Harry tenderly kiss your face, then felt his hand take yours as he led you back into the party. You smiled at people as you greeted them once again, discussing your art, with Harry not leaving your side the remainder of the event.

As the opening dwindled, with only a few people still looking around, Harry saw how ready you appeared for some relaxation. Following the last few people to the door, he thanked them and locked the door behind them. Walking back to where you stood in the next room, looking around at everything, Harry smiled at you, handing you a fresh flute of champagne and clinking your glass.

“To the birth of an amazing art gallery,” Harry said. “May it be everything you want it to be, love.”

“Thank you,” you smiled, sipping from the glass.

“I have a surprise for you,” Harry grinned, taking your hand and walking you to the workshop in the back of the building. As you stepped through the doorway, you saw a blanket spread across the floor, food adorning it, as Harry walked you toward it. “I think today was a huge success. So we are going to celebrate with an amazing dinner I had sent from our favorite restaurant and strategically had sneaked through the backdoor. The doors are all locked and it’s only us. No one else I would rather be with at this moment than you.”

You felt Harry lean to you, a sweet kiss placed lightly on your lips, he holding your hand as you sat on the large blanket. As you watched Harry pull the food out, you debated in your mind over something you had been thinking about, feeling it was now the right time to share it with him.

“May I tell you something?” you asked, as he glanced to you with a smile.

“You can always tell me anything, you know that,” he said sweetly, glancing over the food then to you.

“I’ve been wanting to tell you this for a while,” you said slowly. “I wasn’t sure if I should. But now…I know I want to, regardless of what you think about it.”

“I’m sure it will be fine,” Harry chuckled and smiled. “Tell me, go on now.”

“When I was in the hospital,” you started. “When I had the panic attack and fainted and you took me, and I was so sick…”

“Yeah…” Harry said, looking at you tenderly.

“I had a dream,” you spoke. “I know I wasn’t really in my head most of the time. It was very strange.”

“It’s all right,” Harry said. “At least we know why now.”

You nodded then continued.

“I had a dream,” you repeated, Harry listening closely as you told your thoughts. “In the dream…you told me…you were still in love with me. That you never stopped loving me after we broke up.”

You watched as his smile fell into a concentrated look.

“You said that you wished I wasn’t with Michael,” you continued, thinking. “That you wished the two of us were together again, like before. I didn’t want to tell you, because I didn’t want to make you feel uncomfortable about it, especially since I was still dating Michael. But…with everything I’ve been dealing with, and most recently beginning to realize…my life could be at risk now…”

Harry swallowed hard at the thought.

“I decided,” you said, looking at him intensely. “I decided I want to be honest with you about my feelings, whether you feel the same or not. I hate the thought of something happening to me and you never knowing how I truly feel about you.”

“I don’t want to think about something happening to you, babe,” Harry said. “You’re going to be fine now. You’ll be safe.”

“I know,” you nodded, smiling softly to him. “And I thank you for that.”

You looked at him another moment and took a deep breath.

“I know it was only a dream,” you said. “But…I never…fell out of love with you. I started dating Michael, hoping it would help me to get over you. I think that’s why I could never let myself get close to him. I do still love you, as more than just best friends, and I want you to know that, in case something would happen to me. I know you’ve moved on, and…that’s okay. I’m just so thankful we’re still best friends.”

Seeing the uncertainty in your eyes, wondering how he would react to what you had admitted, Harry moved closely to you and held your hand in his.

“It wasn’t a dream,” Harry said. “In the hospital, you didn’t dream it. I really said it to you, love. You hadn’t woken yet, but I couldn’t keep my secret from you anymore. I had to tell you, even if you couldn’t hear me, or…at least, I thought you couldn’t. I didn’t want you to hate me because I said it and you were still with Michael.”

“I could never hate you, Harry…”

“I am still so in love with you, baby,” Harry said, as his eyes began to glisten. “I’ve never fallen out of love with you. I just wanted to respect your relationship you were in. I’ve never stopped loving you.”

Seeing a tear slowly slide down your cheek, Harry leaned closely to you, holding your face in his hand, pressing his lips gently to yours, tasting you once again after such a long time away from that level of intimacy with you. Pulling away slightly again, Harry looked at you.

“I’m so in love with you, baby,” he whispered.

Kissing you passionately, Harry held you, wanting to keep you in his arms forever. Leaning away from you slightly, Harry kept you in his hold, as you both looked into each other’s tear-filled eyes. No words needed spoken. You both knew. Everything was finally going to be as it should be again.

Harry’s mouth on your neck was even more comforting than you remembered it feeling, as he left soft kisses along your jaw, leaning you backward on the blanket, he looking down over you as a smile appeared on his face.

“I’ve missed you,” he whispered, kissing you softly again.

“I’ve missed you…so much,” you returned, leaning up to nibble at his jaw, as you sucked a gentle kiss to his neck, hearing him groan softly.

Feeling his hand move from your waist, slowly down your hip, his mouth searching yours again, he grasped your thigh in his wide-spread fingers, pulling your leg up to rest on his thigh. Pulling his head back, the look on Harry’s face said everything the two of you were feeling in that moment. It was the same look you remembered seeing when you were together. Harry woke, smiling as he remembered the hours before, making love with you as you reunited as lovers. Looking to the side of his bed you were still sleeping in, Harry turned over to face you, wrapping his arms around you and pulling you flush against his body, flowering kisses across your back and shoulders. Hearing you breath in more deeply, he felt you turn in his arms and face him, opening your eyes and smiling at him.

“Fuck, you’re beautiful,” he grinned to you as you smiled. “Even first thing of a morning, so beautiful.”

“I was afraid I would wake and find this had all been a dream,” you grinned honestly. “I’m so happy it wasn’t.”

“Never letting you go again, baby,” Harry said. “In fact, I’ve been thinking about something.”

“About what?”

Harry grinned to you, kissing you lightly and readjusting his arm around you.

“Had things gone differently,” he said. “And we hadn’t split up, or…you had come with me on tour maybe…had things been different in our careers…I would have asked you by now to live with me.”

Harry watched as you processed what he was saying, seeing your lips form a smile as he chuckled.

“I know we’ve only gotten back together now, but,” Harry started. “I’d like…for you to live with me, move into my home. No more apartment. I want you here, with me. I would have asked you had we stayed together, and especially now with all that’s happened…”

“You…want me to live with you?”

“More than fucking anything, babe,” Harry said. “I was going to ask you anyway, as best friends and with the security issues. But especially now that we’re together again. I want it more than you can imagine.”

You saw the watering in his eyes as he smiled and chuckled at your smiling silence.

“I want you here with me, all the time,” Harry said. “I want to be able to come home to you after work. I want your clothes hanging in the closet next to mine, mixed together in the laundry with mine. And your toothbrush with mine at the sink, your things next to mine in the shower or on the dresser. I want us to share…everything.”

Harry saw a tear fall from your eye to the pillow under your face, as you laughed gently.

“I want everything with you,” Harry said. “Please…”

Unable to speak in your happiness, you released a giggling sob, nodding your head, wrapping your arms around him as he laughed.

“It’s going to be amazing, baby,” Harry smiled. “Absolutely amazing.”

*

“That’s the last one,” Harry said, as he brought a box in from the other room. You looked around the tiny apartment as he walked to you, holding his arms around your shoulders from behind and kissing the side of your face. “Are you going to miss living here?”

“Are you serious?” you laughed. “Fuck, no.”

Harry laughed as you smiled at him.

“Do you remember the first time you stayed the night here with me?” you asked with a grin.

“That little matchbox of a bed you had then,” he chuckled. “My fuckin’ legs hung over the end by nearly a foot!”

You both laughed, looking around the little room.

“Not like we slept or anything that night,” you teased.

“Fuck right we didn’t sleep,” Harry said, kissing your neck, nibbling at your earlobe. “For two full fucking days…”

You turned to face him, as he kissed you deeply, then left three or four smaller kisses gently to your lips with a smile.

“Come on, love,” Harry said. “One last time before we go?”

You giggled as Harry grabbed your hand, laughing all the way into the bedroom. In time, the moving van arrived and you and Harry packed everything inside of it, taking your things back to Harry’s home…your new home with Harry. You were beyond happy.

*

For weeks you hadn’t heard anything out of Michael and you hoped he was done harassing you. You obviously hadn’t told him you moved from the apartment, but believing that your intruder was most likely him, his key would no longer work so you assumed he would figure it out eventually.

As you stepped out of the passenger side of the vehicle, Harry quickly made his way around the car, standing next to you and grabbing your hand as he walked you to the front door of the gallery. Your business was doing very well, you and Harry were beyond happy together, and you felt like you were finally almost yourself again. You still worked with Dr. Glen, but felt healthy again, even though you still knew your mind was a work in progress.

“Everything looks good here,” Harry said, handing you your coffee cup. “So I’m going to get to my meeting, then I’m going to do some writing this afternoon. You have anything on your agenda?”

“I have a ten o’clock sculpting class,” you grinned. “Then I’m hoping this afternoon I can work in the workshop for a while since Katie seems to be working out really well in here with the daily stuff.”

“Yeah, she seems nice,” Harry said. “All right, love, I’m going to get on then. Call if you need me. Nothing major for me today anyway. I’ll bring us lunch in later before I go off to write, yeah?”

“Sounds wonderful,” you said, accepting his kiss and long hug. “That feels so good.”

“Beyond good,” he said, holding you a moment longer. “I’ll be here around one?”


You nodded and smiled as he kissed you quickly again, then hearing the front door and seeing Katie walk inside.

“Mornin’,” Harry said to her then turned again. “See you in a few hours, baby. Love you.”

“Love you.”

Thankful. That’s all you could say about your life finally becoming calm and more normal again. You were thankful to Dr. Glen for helping you work through the pieces of your mind that Michael had twisted into a knot of confusion and disorientation. You were forever thankful to Harry for staying by your side, being the perfect definition of what a best friend should really be. And you were thankful that Michael appeared to have finally given up on you and was leaving you alone. The restraining order Harry acquired to protect you may have helped with that, too, but still, you were thankful Michael was abiding by it. You didn’t know where Michael had gone or what he was doing, and you didn’t care, as long as he continued to stay far away from you and Harry.

You still struggled with thoughts in your mind about Michael. Thoughts that you worked on in every session with Dr. Glen. You understood now that Michael had said and done many things with the intent of manipulating you. But it was still difficult for you to see the depth of his deceit sometimes. You thought he must either be an amazing actor, or maybe some of his feelings for you were sincere. Although you knew you never loved him, you really had liked him as a person until things become too much. But…he did do things to you that proved it was not a healthy relationship, things that had put a fear in you toward him, and Dr. Glen and Harry both worked with you to help you see those things more clearly, helping you to find yourself again. Retraining your mind…that’s what you were doing with their help, and you were extremely thankful Michael had apparently removed himself from the situation all together.

Having taught your only class scheduled that day, you cleaned the area again, then prepared your mind for the tasks of your afternoon. It was exciting to have been commissioned for a piece of art by another London gallery, known for showcasing other local artists. It was a badge of acceptance in your eyes that you were asked, and you wanted to make sure it was a perfect example of your work.

“Do you mind if I leave a few minutes early for lunch? I have a lunch date,” Katie smiled.

“Mmmm, same guy?” you giggled.

“Yeah,” she grinned. “Seems to be a good guy.”

“That’s great,” you smiled. “Go ahead, it’s fine. Harry should be here any minute with lunch.”

“Thanks,” she said. “See you in a bit.”

You turned back around and looked through a couple of drawers, trying to find the tools you would need for the commission work you would begin on that afternoon. Hearing the door open, you hollered into the gallery.

“I’m in the workshop, Harry!”

You heard the footsteps walking through the gallery, across the stone floors, then walking behind you.

“Just in time,” you said, pushing the drawer closed again. “Katie just left for lunch, too.”

Hearing only footsteps, you turned as your smile dropped from your face, seeing Michael continuing his path toward you. Out of instinct you reached to the counter next to you, grabbing the sharp carving blade in your hand and holding it straight out in front of you, causing Michael to stop in his steps a few feet away.

“Come on, sweetheart,” Michael smiled gently. “It’s been so long since I’ve seen you. I just came to see how you’re doing, see how the gallery is doing.”

You saw how badly you were shaking, barely seeming a threat, but you knew the knife in your hand was sharp enough to leave a deep slice in anything it touched.

“You need to leave,” you stated firmly. “I have security cameras everywhere, recording you being here.”

“And?” he asked. “I’m doing nothing wrong. I’m not hurting you. You’re the only one who’s threatening right now.”

“Because I know you too well,” you spoke. “Now leave, Michael.”

“I won’t,” he said. “I came here to see you, and I’m going to. Now stop with this and put that away.”

He began to step closer as you shakily held the blade closer to him, he retracting his step back again.

“I have a restraining order on you,” you announced. “You’re breaking the law by being here.”

“I know, and I’m sorry you felt you needed one against me,” he saddened. “I would never intentionally hurt you, sweetheart. This has all become such a mess. There’s so much you don’t know. I just want time to explain everything to you, so you don’t hate me. I know you live with Harry now, I’ve seen you together.”

“My life is none of your business,” you spoke more sternly, your eyes burning from the tears you were holding back, perspiration beginning to form on your brow and upper lip from your fear.

“Oh, my love…your life will always be my business,” he swooned. “I know you’re in love with Harry, probably always have been. It explains a lot, honestly. But that doesn’t change how I feel about you. I love you, probably too much, and I know if you would just give me a chance, you could love me, too. But even if you’re with Harry, I’ll always be around somewhere. That’s how much I love you. You may not see me, or hear me, or even know I’m there, but I will be, have to be…just like in your apartment. I was always there. Even the nights Harry was there with you.”

You panted in your growing fear, holding the sharp chisel high at his throat-level, but not backing down.

“I’ll have you thrown in jail,” you said more loudly as your voice wavered slightly. “I know everything you did to me when we were dating. All of the mind tricks you played on me, making me think I was losing my mind. What kind of a person does that?!”

“Sweetheart,” he said softly. “I can explain all of that, I swear. It wasn’t my fault, I had to. You just don’t understand. It wasn’t…me…I mean, it was, but…”

“It was you!” you yelled shakily.

Harry heard your voice as he walked into the gallery, hearing the fear and strain in it, as he quietly closed the door behind him.

“It was you! I know everything that you’ve done to me!” you cried, your arm shaking terribly toward him, nearly nicking him with the sharp cutting edge.

Harry quietly stepped through the gallery toward the workshop, peeking inside the doorway and seeing you holding the knife out in front of you, shaking terribly.

“I’ve never hurt you,” Michael said calmly. “Even the day you broke your arm. It wasn’t…I mean…”

“You…you were here?” you questioned, Harry seeing the look of confusion slowly overcoming your face, but keeping the knife toward Michael.

“I just need to explain…tell you everything,” Michael said, seeing you slowly letting down your guard. “I never wanted you to get hurt…”

“No…” you said, shaking your head and holding the tool high. “I remember now. You were here. You…you tried to force me to leave with you. But I…I fought you…and…threatened to yell to anyone who could hear that you were kidnapping me…”

You gasped as you suddenly saw Harry attack Michael from behind.

“You stay the fuck away from her!” Harry yelled, as the two men fought.

Losing the shock of what you were seeing, you reached for the silent alarm button under the cabinet ledge and backed into the corner. You saw Michael kick at Harry, trying to separate himself from him, pulling on the leg of a nearby stool and toppling it onto Harry. Feeling the release of Harry’s hands on him, Michael ran for the door.

Harry quickly got to his feet, running to the doorway but seeing Michael had already disappeared out the front door of the building. Looking back to where you were standing, white as a ghost and still shaking, Harry ran to you. Pulling you into his arms, kissing your face over and over, he held you tightly.

“Are you all right? Did he hurt you?” Harry asked, looking over your body for signs of blood or trauma.

“I’m okay,” you said, clutching him tightly. “I’m okay.”

“Police!” you both heard from the other room.

“We’re in here!” Harry shouted back, as you saw them walk into the room.

You and Harry described everything that happened, Harry requesting enforcement of the restraining order. Deciding there had been enough excitement for the day, Harry called Katie, giving her the rest of the day off, feeling it best he should take you home. He walked to where you were, sitting down next to you and pulling your hand into his, kissing it.

“I remembered,” you said quietly, as he looked to you, knowing you were pleased. Something that had happened to you made sense, and you had remembered what had happened.

“Yeah,” Harry grinned lightly. “You did well, baby.”

“Are you all right? Did he hurt you?” Harry asked, looking over your body for signs of blood or trauma.

“I’m okay,” you said, clutching him tightly. “I’m okay.”

“Police!” you both heard from the other room.

“We’re in here!” Harry shouted back, as you saw them walk into the room.

You and Harry described everything that happened, Harry requesting enforcement of the restraining order. Deciding there had been enough excitement for the day, Harry called Katie, giving her the rest of the day off, feeling it best he should take you home. He walked to where you were, sitting down next to you and pulling your hand into his, kissing it.

“I remembered,” you said quietly, as he looked to you, knowing you were pleased. Something that had happened to you made sense, and you had remembered what had happened.

“Yeah,” Harry grinned lightly. “You did well, baby.”

title: Never Sometimes Always - Chapter Two
body:
Thank you all so much for liking and reblogging and following. I didn’t expect feedback so fast. That really does motivate me to work harder. I’m currently working on an imagine and another series already lol so I hope you guys enjoy. Links to the series and my masterlist is at the bottom of the page!

 d x

Never Sometimes Always – Chapter Two

Violet actually didn’t want to go to Anne’s tonight.

Sure, she knows Anne and she’s friendly with her. She would even go as far as consider Anne a good friend. But that doesn’t change the fact that they are filthy rich and Violet virtually has nothing.

Really, it’s not that Violet thinks they’re stuck up. They are possibly the nicest people on Earth from what she’s gathered. It’s just…they seem to be in a different world than she’s in. It’s not like Violet didn’t take notice of the different variations of Prada bags Anne owned. Or the fact that her trainers were Gucci. It’s just very hard for her not to notice these things and Violet doesn’t want to go to their probably lavish house looking…poor.

She slams her head down on her textbook with a groan. She can’t focus. Or maybe it’s the fact that Probability and Statistics is the most useless subject. Both are likely.

“Honey, is that a new way of taking in knowledge? Man, how the times have changed.”

Violet turns her face towards the door where her father stood. She shot him a weak smile and he chucked before coming into her room and lying across her bed. She wishes she could do that, but she genuinely needs to stay at this desk until she finishes these questions.

“I wish.”

Violet picks her head up and rests it on her hand, her elbow supporting the weight. Her dad smiles at her and says, “that’d be pretty cool, to be frank.” She chuckles at him. Her dad is so…cool? Is that the word? She isn’t sure. But she does know that he gets her better than anyone.

Violet heard a soft knock on her room door and turns to find her mum. She makes her way into the room to the lie against her husband. Violet can’t help but admire her parents’ relationship. They met after university and if she recalls the story correctly her father was with someone else at the time. Her dad was just starting up and photocopying business and her mom was new to Cheshire.

They quite literally ran into each other with their trolleys at the Sainsbury’s midtown. After a few awkward apologies, the pair realised how funny the situation was. They traded numbers soon after that. It wasn’t long after meeting her mom that her father left his previous girlfriend. After spending so much time with her, showing her around town, and taking her for some burgers at Jamie Oliver’s in nearby Manchester, he just knew he had to be with her forever.

“Why do you look so worried, hon?”

Violet wants to cry hearing her mums soft tone. Being at university away from her parents is truly a blessing and she is grateful for it, the privacy and the peace and the freedom, but it will never fill her heart the way being home does. To have these two people who love and care for her unconditionally is really what she needed right now. Especially with her final exams creeping up on her.

 “Just really tired of bloody maths.”

“Take a break. You’ve been in here since you got back from work,” her father suggests.

She shakes her head in disagreement. “Can’t. I’ve got dinner at…a friends house tonight and I need to finish now so I can spend tomorrow studying for my Anatomy and Physiology exam.”

Her parents hum in understanding. “We’ll leave then and let you work.”

“No!” She coughs in embarrassment at her outburst. “Please stay. I haven’t seen you two in so long.”

Violet’s mum smiles. “Whose house are you having dinner at?”

“Anne’s.”

Dad chimes in with, “the lady who always comes in the shop. Her kid’s famous, innit? Singer, actor something like that.”

Violet nods. “…something like that.”

This sets some kind of signal off in Violet’s mum. “What are you gonna wear? Is it a fancy dinner or just casual? What time are you going over? It’s supposed to shower tonight? Let me check your suitcase.”

Violet doesn’t respond to any of her mums questions. She just looks at her dad with an amused expression and he responds with a shrug before whipping his ringing phone from his trousers.

“Is the boy going to be there?” She nods at her mums question. “Then we’ll have to dress you up real nice.”

Violet slouches in her chair. “No, mum. I’m not trying to wow anyone. I don’t really wanna go anyway.”

“Well, why not?” Violet looks around the room before focusing in on the string coming from her trackie bottoms. She shrugs. “Is it because…because of the m–“

“No, mum.”

“It’s okay, sweetie. I understand that.” Her mum rubs her shoulder and she nods timidly. “But that’s not an excuse not to go.” And then she’s digging away in Violet’s luggage again. 

When Violet said lavish house she didn’t expect it to be parked up in a gated community. She had to give her driver’s identification card to security so they could cross reference her name with the guest list. It was all quite odd. She’s beginning to second question this whole ordeal.

Is she even dressed for the occasion?

 Some jeans, a tube top, and a cardigan. That should be good enough, right?

When she and her parents (who insisted on dropping her off) got to the house, they were gobsmacked. The front garden was riddled with the most beautiful arrangement of flowers, benches, and ferns. Their house was three stories and though it was large it still looked like…a home.

“Well, shit…”

 “Jeffery!” Violet’s mum scolded. Violet laughed and opened her door. “Call us when you’re ready for us to come to get you.”

She nods silently and exits the vehicle. As soon as she puts her foot down the front porch lights up. Anne steps out of the house with a smile and she sends a wave to the little family.

“Come in, come in!”

Violet hears the car turn off and she begins to panic. “Oh, they were just dropping me off.”

“Nonsense! Come on in!”

Violet really hates this.

She’s not embarrassed of her parents by any means. They hold the highest pedestal in her life. But she is constantly embarrassed by her parents, which is what she’s worried about. Her dad is gonna tell that stupid nappy story again, she can sense it. And her mum is gonna compliment everything in sight. This is what they do. Thank goodness this wasn’t happening at their house. Her father would literally show guests where Violet peed on the carpet when she was three.

“Lovely garden you have, Anne.”

And so it begins.

Harry and Violet were across from each other at the massive table. Beside her was her mum and then on the other side was her dad. Beside Harry sat Anne.

Besides the scraping of utensils against glass and Violet’s mum’s occasional compliment, there wasn’t much noise. Violet begins to wonder how Anne could possibly live here all by herself.

“Wow, and Violet you plan on studying for your postgraduate the fall after next?” She nods at Anne. “Amazing. This one here didn’t even attempt his A-levels.”

Violet smiles at Harry and when he returned it, her heart flipped. “Trust me, you didn’t miss anything,” she says.

The conversation continued, her dad told the nappy story not once but twice. He even decided to mix it up and tell the story of how their first guinea pig peed on her. However, Violet is grateful that Anne is spitting out funny stories about Harry as well.

“You covered you mum in frogs because you thought it would help?” Violet snorts out a laugh.

“Okay, look. It was only three frogs and I thought if she saw how cool they were she wouldn’t be scared of them anymore!”

Violet laughs. “Where is the logic in that?”

Harry just laughed and shook his head down at his plate. She kind of wants to see that smile forever.

As Violet is digging into her pasta she feels a soft shove against her foot. She looks under the table just as Harry’s foot stopped under his seat. When she glanced up at him he had a small smile on his face. He cocks his head towards the door. Violet smiles with a nod.

“‘Right mum. We’re going.”

Conversation abruptly came to a halt and all eyes are on the two. Anne wipes her mouth with a napkin. “Where to?”

“Front room. I want Violet to review my album since she’s never heard my music before.” Harry addressed the situation in a mocking tone and Violet couldn’t help but roll her eyes.

Anne smiled at the two. “Okay then. Have fun. Sweet Creature is my favourite.”

Violet nods and follows Harry away from the table and to the kitchen. A silence washes over them as they scrap leftovers from their plates into the bin. Violet watches his every move. She felt like she was on the verge of breaking something every two minutes, so maybe if she followed him around she wouldn’t.

As the pair were maneuvering around the small (large?) space, she couldn’t help but notice the stark differences between their homes. Violet’s parents’ kitchen had a small bay window over the split sink. Her mum had these tiny teal coloured curtains up for privacy and a tomato planter that had been on the windowpane for the past four years that Violet’s dad refuses to trash. They had an average white fridge, a dish drying rack on the side and a tiny two stool island in the centre. It was a very average kitchen. Chestnut cupboards and white laminate flooring. Violet liked their kitchen. But this kitchen…Violet loved this kitchen.

The dim ceiling lights gave off a soft, golden glow that complemented the modern palm leaf wallpaper covering half of the kitchen. She noticed that the knobs on the hob, the cupboard handles, and even the silverware have gold bits in them. It’s probably real. There were two iceboxes, both of them larger than Harry, had the same wood detail that was on the cupboards making them blend into the aesthetic of the room effortlessly. The second fridge, however, was see through and only contained drinks. Violet couldn’t help but look around the room in wonder. It was insane how beautiful just a kitchen could be.

“You comin’?”

Violet hears the amusement in Harry’s voice before she sees it in his face. She could feel her cheeks heat. “Sorry.”

He turns and she follows him, doing her best to avoid looking at anything except his back. She felt like it’s almost a bit disrespectful to peep around anymore. Even though she had been invited over, she felt that he’d had enough people trying to invade his life and she didn’t want to be one of them.

Harry snagged his laptop from the couch in the centre of the second family room before sitting in that same spot. He patted the cushion next to him and sent Violet a grin. “Alright, since everyone is so up my arse, you’ll be the judge of my music.”

“Finally, someone with taste,” Violet huffs before flopping down in the spot beside him. He lets out one loud laugh while clicking around on his MacBook.

“Okay,” he says, glancing at her briefly before looking back at his laptop, “the first song I’m gonna play for you here is Only Angel. It’s one of my favourites.”

“Mmkay.” Violet watches as he sticks a headphone splitter into the laptop. He hands her a pair of headphones and she pushes them into her ears. She genuinely hopes his music is good because she can’t fathom telling The Harry Styles his music is shit. Surely it isn’t though. He’s right, he has could a couple hundred thousand, probably a couple million, that love his voice so it can’t be a fluke.

The song starts and instantly Violet feels transcended. Was this a choir, was this him? Was this God? Okay, that’s a stretch, she knows, but already this piece sounded heavenly. Literally. There was such an ethereal, soft feel. Then,

Hey, hey!

Violet’s eyes widen in surprise and she leaned back in the couch a bit shocked. The song bursts into a very heavy 70s rock-influenced track. She did not see that coming. Harry was eating it up. Someone outside of his family, producers, and bandmates is listening to his music and is going to give him actual feedback.

Broke a finger knocking on your bedroom door

I got splinters in my knuckles crawling ‘cross the floor

Couldn’t take you home to mother in a skirt that short

But I think that’s what I like about it

 

She’s an angel.

 

Violet found herself almost frozen. This song was so…sensual. It sounded like Harry was no stranger to the casual one-night stand. Violet wouldn’t know, but from the way he’s singing about it, it sounds like a divine and celestial experience.

When the song finished Violet let out a huff of air. She was taken aback. She wasn’t expecting that. The Harry she listened to was maybe sixteen, seventeen and sang about first kisses. Because she hadn’t kept up with him like everyone else in their little village, she didn’t realise how much he’d grown up.

“Well,” he drags out. He’s been waiting for a response for a minute or two. He won’t admit it, but he hopes she likes it. Harry, since he first met her, found himself wanting to empress her.

“It’s…” she breaths heavily out of her mouth before turning to look Harry in the eye, “…yeah.”

Harry frowns. “Not your cup ‘o tea?”

“No,” she shouts, “I mean, yeah. It’s great. Its…it’s amazing. I’m just a bit shocked. This is the first time I’ve heard, like, any of your music since, what was that album, Midnight Memories.”

“So, you like it.” He says it as a statement and he’s grinning now. She’s kind of glad she was able to do that. “Recorded it in one take.”

“Yeah, Harry. It’s great. The contrast was amazing.”

He lets out a bit of a giggle and Violet’s heart swells. As he’s pulling up the next song, Violet is studying him. He’s got a mole by his lip and she reckons it’s the cutest thing she’s ever seen; besides the way he’s pinching his bottom lip in concentration. She shouldn’t be looking at him like this. Hasn’t he got some supermodel girlfriend?

“This next one, it means a lot to me. It took me a while to finish it, but I think I like it.”

Violet closes her eyes and lets her body relax into the sofa as the folk-rock tune surrounded her. Halfway through the song, she recognises that despite the upbeat tune, the lyrics are melancholy. She could sense some sort of disconnect and inability to move on.

Almost over, had enough from you

And I’ve been prayin’, I never did before

Understand I’m talkin’ to the walls

I’ve been prayin’ ever since New York.

 

Violet finds herself tearing up. She knows exactly who this is about.

She finds herself pulling the headphones off. She begins to wipe her eyes with the sleeve of her graphic t-shirt. Harry clicks pause and pulls his headphones out too.

“’S about Robin, isn’t it?”

Harry has a sharp intake of air before nodding and looking down at the screen. He suddenly wishes he didn’t play this song. “How’d you know?”

“Um, the first part, really, but the second confirmed it. Sounds like you’re talking to doctors or summat.” He looks at her with wonder in his eyes. She continues. “Tell me something, you don’t know nothin’ just pretend you do,” she reads from the computer screen. “Sounds like you’re talkin’ to doctors. And then choose your words cause there’s no antidote for this curse, oh, what’s it waiting for. Must this hurt you just before you go?” There’s a silence. The kind where they can hear each other breathing. “I just remember them coming in the shop all the time. Robin and your mum. Then they stopped coming. And then it was only her. Took a couple weeks, but she told me. I…I’m sorry for your loss.”

Harry nods sending her a small smile. “Thank you.”

“Thank you,” she retaliates, “for trusting me. And not think it’s weird that I know all the television shows you watched as a tot.”

Harry chuckles. “Reckon that’s mums fault there.” They laugh together.

Violet’s never felt like this before. This feeling of peace in someone’s presence that she hardly knew. She liked Harry. Maybe more than she should but that doesn’t matter right now. What matters now is the gold flakes sparkling in his eyes and the way his lips looked like her favourite watermelon candy floss. She wonders if his lips taste like watermelon candy floss too.

“Can I have yeh number?” 

She doesn’t hesitate when she takes her mobile out her back pocket. This causes her to shuffle a bit closer to him, their knees now touching. She lays it softly in his hand and he gives her his. Even their phones are different. The iPhone X felt so luxurious in her. She can only guess what he’s thinking about her 5S.

“Violet, honey,” Violet’s mum rounds the corner with her dad and Anne, “it’s getting late.”

“Okay.” Violet stands and hands Harry his phone back and vice versa. “It was nice meeting you, Harry.”

“Was nice meeting you too. Hopefully, I’ll see you again soon.”

Her heart flutters for the umpteenth time that night. She knows he knows what he’s doing to her surly. She decides to be cheeky and responds with, “you will.”

Anne and Harry see the family of three off and when Violet gets home she bids her parents good night and jogs to her room. She felt a smile on her face as she clambered into bed. And just as her head hit her pillow, just as her eyes shut and her breathing slowed, her phone buzzed. She picked it up, flinching at the harsh light. A smile stretched across her face when she read the text. She didn’t know where this was going, but she didn’t mind where it was at now.

“Finally, someone with taste,” Violet huffs before flopping down in the spot beside him. He lets out one loud laugh while clicking around on his MacBook.

“Okay,” he says, glancing at her briefly before looking back at his laptop, “the first song I’m gonna play for you here is Only Angel. It’s one of my favourites.”

“Mmkay.” Violet watches as he sticks a headphone splitter into the laptop. He hands her a pair of headphones and she pushes them into her ears. She genuinely hopes his music is good because she can’t fathom telling The Harry Styles his music is shit. Surely it isn’t though. He’s right, he has could a couple hundred thousand, probably a couple million, that love his voice so it can’t be a fluke.

The song starts and instantly Violet feels transcended. Was this a choir, was this him? Was this God? Okay, that’s a stretch, she knows, but already this piece sounded heavenly. Literally. There was such an ethereal, soft feel. Then,

Hey, hey!

Violet’s eyes widen in surprise and she leaned back in the couch a bit shocked. The song bursts into a very heavy 70s rock-influenced track. She did not see that coming. Harry was eating it up. Someone outside of his family, producers, and bandmates is listening to his music and is going to give him actual feedback.

Broke a finger knocking on your bedroom door

I got splinters in my knuckles crawling ‘cross the floor

Couldn’t take you home to mother in a skirt that short

But I think that’s what I like about it

 

She’s an angel.

 

Violet found herself almost frozen. This song was so…sensual. It sounded like Harry was no stranger to the casual one-night stand. Violet wouldn’t know, but from the way he’s singing about it, it sounds like a divine and celestial experience.

When the song finished Violet let out a huff of air. She was taken aback. She wasn’t expecting that. The Harry she listened to was maybe sixteen, seventeen and sang about first kisses. Because she hadn’t kept up with him like everyone else in their little village, she didn’t realise how much he’d grown up.

“Well,” he drags out. He’s been waiting for a response for a minute or two. He won’t admit it, but he hopes she likes it. Harry, since he first met her, found himself wanting to empress her.

“It’s…” she breaths heavily out of her mouth before turning to look Harry in the eye, “…yeah.”

Harry frowns. “Not your cup ‘o tea?”

“No,” she shouts, “I mean, yeah. It’s great. Its…it’s amazing. I’m just a bit shocked. This is the first time I’ve heard, like, any of your music since, what was that album, Midnight Memories.”

“So, you like it.” He says it as a statement and he’s grinning now. She’s kind of glad she was able to do that. “Recorded it in one take.”

“Yeah, Harry. It’s great. The contrast was amazing.”

He lets out a bit of a giggle and Violet’s heart swells. As he’s pulling up the next song, Violet is studying him. He’s got a mole by his lip and she reckons it’s the cutest thing she’s ever seen; besides the way he’s pinching his bottom lip in concentration. She shouldn’t be looking at him like this. Hasn’t he got some supermodel girlfriend?

“This next one, it means a lot to me. It took me a while to finish it, but I think I like it.”

Violet closes her eyes and lets her body relax into the sofa as the folk-rock tune surrounded her. Halfway through the song, she recognises that despite the upbeat tune, the lyrics are melancholy. She could sense some sort of disconnect and inability to move on.

Almost over, had enough from you

And I’ve been prayin’, I never did before

Understand I’m talkin’ to the walls

I’ve been prayin’ ever since New York.

 

Violet finds herself tearing up. She knows exactly who this is about.

She finds herself pulling the headphones off. She begins to wipe her eyes with the sleeve of her graphic t-shirt. Harry clicks pause and pulls his headphones out too.

“’S about Robin, isn’t it?”

Harry has a sharp intake of air before nodding and looking down at the screen. He suddenly wishes he didn’t play this song. “How’d you know?”

“Um, the first part, really, but the second confirmed it. Sounds like you’re talking to doctors or summat.” He looks at her with wonder in his eyes. She continues. “Tell me something, you don’t know nothin’ just pretend you do,” she reads from the computer screen. “Sounds like you’re talkin’ to doctors. And then choose your words cause there’s no antidote for this curse, oh, what’s it waiting for. Must this hurt you just before you go?” There’s a silence. The kind where they can hear each other breathing. “I just remember them coming in the shop all the time. Robin and your mum. Then they stopped coming. And then it was only her. Took a couple weeks, but she told me. I…I’m sorry for your loss.”

Harry nods sending her a small smile. “Thank you.”

“Thank you,” she retaliates, “for trusting me. And not think it’s weird that I know all the television shows you watched as a tot.”

Harry chuckles. “Reckon that’s mums fault there.” They laugh together.

Violet’s never felt like this before. This feeling of peace in someone’s presence that she hardly knew. She liked Harry. Maybe more than she should but that doesn’t matter right now. What matters now is the gold flakes sparkling in his eyes and the way his lips looked like her favourite watermelon candy floss. She wonders if his lips taste like watermelon candy floss too.

“Can I have yeh number?” 

She doesn’t hesitate when she takes her mobile out her back pocket. This causes her to shuffle a bit closer to him, their knees now touching. She lays it softly in his hand and he gives her his. Even their phones are different. The iPhone X felt so luxurious in her. She can only guess what he’s thinking about her 5S.

“Violet, honey,” Violet’s mum rounds the corner with her dad and Anne, “it’s getting late.”

“Okay.” Violet stands and hands Harry his phone back and vice versa. “It was nice meeting you, Harry.”

“Was nice meeting you too. Hopefully, I’ll see you again soon.”

Her heart flutters for the umpteenth time that night. She knows he knows what he’s doing to her surly. She decides to be cheeky and responds with, “you will.”

Anne and Harry see the family of three off and when Violet gets home she bids her parents good night and jogs to her room. She felt a smile on her face as she clambered into bed. And just as her head hit her pillow, just as her eyes shut and her breathing slowed, her phone buzzed. She picked it up, flinching at the harsh light. A smile stretched across her face when she read the text. She didn’t know where this was going, but she didn’t mind where it was at now.

Never Sometimes Always – Chapter Two

Violet actually didn’t want to go to Anne’s tonight.

Sure, she knows Anne and she’s friendly with her. She would even go as far as consider Anne a good friend. But that doesn’t change the fact that they are filthy rich and Violet virtually has nothing.

Really, it’s not that Violet thinks they’re stuck up. They are possibly the nicest people on Earth from what she’s gathered. It’s just…they seem to be in a different world than she’s in. It’s not like Violet didn’t take notice of the different variations of Prada bags Anne owned. Or the fact that her trainers were Gucci. It’s just very hard for her not to notice these things and Violet doesn’t want to go to their probably lavish house looking…poor.

[[MORE]]

She slams her head down on her textbook with a groan. She can’t focus. Or maybe it’s the fact that Probability and Statistics is the most useless subject. Both are likely.

“Honey, is that a new way of taking in knowledge? Man, how the times have changed.”

Violet turns her face towards the door where her father stood. She shot him a weak smile and he chucked before coming into her room and lying across her bed. She wishes she could do that, but she genuinely needs to stay at this desk until she finishes these questions.

“I wish.”

Violet picks her head up and rests it on her hand, her elbow supporting the weight. Her dad smiles at her and says, “that’d be pretty cool, to be frank.” She chuckles at him. Her dad is so…cool? Is that the word? She isn’t sure. But she does know that he gets her better than anyone.

Violet heard a soft knock on her room door and turns to find her mum. She makes her way into the room to the lie against her husband. Violet can’t help but admire her parents’ relationship. They met after university and if she recalls the story correctly her father was with someone else at the time. Her dad was just starting up and photocopying business and her mom was new to Cheshire.

They quite literally ran into each other with their trolleys at the Sainsbury’s midtown. After a few awkward apologies, the pair realised how funny the situation was. They traded numbers soon after that. It wasn’t long after meeting her mom that her father left his previous girlfriend. After spending so much time with her, showing her around town, and taking her for some burgers at Jamie Oliver’s in nearby Manchester, he just knew he had to be with her forever.

“Why do you look so worried, hon?”

Violet wants to cry hearing her mums soft tone. Being at university away from her parents is truly a blessing and she is grateful for it, the privacy and the peace and the freedom, but it will never fill her heart the way being home does. To have these two people who love and care for her unconditionally is really what she needed right now. Especially with her final exams creeping up on her.

 “Just really tired of bloody maths.”

“Take a break. You’ve been in here since you got back from work,” her father suggests.

She shakes her head in disagreement. “Can’t. I’ve got dinner at…a friends house tonight and I need to finish now so I can spend tomorrow studying for my Anatomy and Physiology exam.”

Her parents hum in understanding. “We’ll leave then and let you work.”

“No!” She coughs in embarrassment at her outburst. “Please stay. I haven’t seen you two in so long.”

Violet’s mum smiles. “Whose house are you having dinner at?”

“Anne’s.”

Dad chimes in with, “the lady who always comes in the shop. Her kid’s famous, innit? Singer, actor something like that.”

Violet nods. “…something like that.”

This sets some kind of signal off in Violet’s mum. “What are you gonna wear? Is it a fancy dinner or just casual? What time are you going over? It’s supposed to shower tonight? Let me check your suitcase.”

Violet doesn’t respond to any of her mums questions. She just looks at her dad with an amused expression and he responds with a shrug before whipping his ringing phone from his trousers.

“Is the boy going to be there?” She nods at her mums question. “Then we’ll have to dress you up real nice.”

Violet slouches in her chair. “No, mum. I’m not trying to wow anyone. I don’t really wanna go anyway.”

“Well, why not?” Violet looks around the room before focusing in on the string coming from her trackie bottoms. She shrugs. “Is it because…because of the m–“

“No, mum.”

“It’s okay, sweetie. I understand that.” Her mum rubs her shoulder and she nods timidly. “But that’s not an excuse not to go.” And then she’s digging away in Violet’s luggage again. 

When Violet said lavish house she didn’t expect it to be parked up in a gated community. She had to give her driver’s identification card to security so they could cross reference her name with the guest list. It was all quite odd. She’s beginning to second question this whole ordeal.

Is she even dressed for the occasion?

 Some jeans, a tube top, and a cardigan. That should be good enough, right?

When she and her parents (who insisted on dropping her off) got to the house, they were gobsmacked. The front garden was riddled with the most beautiful arrangement of flowers, benches, and ferns. Their house was three stories and though it was large it still looked like…a home.

“Well, shit…”

 “Jeffery!” Violet’s mum scolded. Violet laughed and opened her door. “Call us when you’re ready for us to come to get you.”

She nods silently and exits the vehicle. As soon as she puts her foot down the front porch lights up. Anne steps out of the house with a smile and she sends a wave to the little family.

“Come in, come in!”

Violet hears the car turn off and she begins to panic. “Oh, they were just dropping me off.”

“Nonsense! Come on in!”

Violet really hates this.

She’s not embarrassed of her parents by any means. They hold the highest pedestal in her life. But she is constantly embarrassed by her parents, which is what she’s worried about. Her dad is gonna tell that stupid nappy story again, she can sense it. And her mum is gonna compliment everything in sight. This is what they do. Thank goodness this wasn’t happening at their house. Her father would literally show guests where Violet peed on the carpet when she was three.

“Lovely garden you have, Anne.”

And so it begins.

Harry and Violet were across from each other at the massive table. Beside her was her mum and then on the other side was her dad. Beside Harry sat Anne.

Besides the scraping of utensils against glass and Violet’s mum’s occasional compliment, there wasn’t much noise. Violet begins to wonder how Anne could possibly live here all by herself.

“Wow, and Violet you plan on studying for your postgraduate the fall after next?” She nods at Anne. “Amazing. This one here didn’t even attempt his A-levels.”

Violet smiles at Harry and when he returned it, her heart flipped. “Trust me, you didn’t miss anything,” she says.

The conversation continued, her dad told the nappy story not once but twice. He even decided to mix it up and tell the story of how their first guinea pig peed on her. However, Violet is grateful that Anne is spitting out funny stories about Harry as well.

“You covered you mum in frogs because you thought it would help?” Violet snorts out a laugh.

“Okay, look. It was only three frogs and I thought if she saw how cool they were she wouldn’t be scared of them anymore!”

Violet laughs. “Where is the logic in that?”

Harry just laughed and shook his head down at his plate. She kind of wants to see that smile forever.

“‘Right mum. We’re going.”

Conversation abruptly came to a halt and all eyes are on the two. Anne wipes her mouth with a napkin. “Where to?”

“Front room. I want Violet to review my album since she’s never heard my music before.” Harry addressed the situation in a mocking tone and Violet couldn’t help but roll her eyes.

Anne smiled at the two. “Okay then. Have fun. Sweet Creature is my favourite.”

Violet nods and follows Harry away from the table and to the kitchen. A silence washes over them as they scrap leftovers from their plates into the bin. Violet watches his every move. She felt like she was on the verge of breaking something every two minutes, so maybe if she followed him around she wouldn’t.

As the pair were maneuvering around the small (large?) space, she couldn’t help but notice the stark differences between their homes. Violet’s parents’ kitchen had a small bay window over the split sink. Her mum had these tiny teal coloured curtains up for privacy and a tomato planter that had been on the windowpane for the past four years that Violet’s dad refuses to trash. They had an average white fridge, a dish drying rack on the side and a tiny two stool island in the centre. It was a very average kitchen. Chestnut cupboards and white laminate flooring. Violet liked their kitchen. But this kitchen…Violet loved this kitchen.

The dim ceiling lights gave off a soft, golden glow that complemented the modern palm leaf wallpaper covering half of the kitchen. She noticed that the knobs on the hob, the cupboard handles, and even the silverware have gold bits in them. It’s probably real. There were two iceboxes, both of them larger than Harry, had the same wood detail that was on the cupboards making them blend into the aesthetic of the room effortlessly. The second fridge, however, was see through and only contained drinks. Violet couldn’t help but look around the room in wonder. It was insane how beautiful just a kitchen could be.

“You comin’?”

Violet hears the amusement in Harry’s voice before she sees it in his face. She could feel her cheeks heat. “Sorry.”

He turns and she follows him, doing her best to avoid looking at anything except his back. She felt like it’s almost a bit disrespectful to peep around anymore. Violet smiles at Harry and when he returned it, her heart flipped. “Trust me, you didn’t miss anything,” she says.

The conversation continued, her dad told the nappy story not once but twice. He even decided to mix it up and tell the story of how their first guinea pig peed on her. However, Violet is grateful that Anne is spitting out funny stories about Harry as well.

“You covered you mum in frogs because you thought it would help?” Violet snorts out a laugh.

“Okay, look. It was only three frogs and I thought if she saw how cool they were she wouldn’t be scared of them anymore!”

Violet laughs. “Where is the logic in that?”

Harry just laughed and shook his head down at his plate. She kind of wants to see that smile forever.

As Violet is digging into her pasta she feels a soft shove against her foot. She looks under the table just as Harry’s foot stopped under his seat. When she glanced up at him he had a small smile on his face. He cocks his head towards the door. Violet smiles with a nod.

“‘Right mum. We’re going.”

Conversation abruptly came to a halt and all eyes are on the two. Anne wipes her mouth with a napkin. “Where to?”

“Front room. I want Violet to review my album since she’s never heard my music before.” Harry addressed the situation in a mocking tone and Violet couldn’t help but roll her eyes.

Anne smiled at the two. “Okay then. Have fun. Sweet Creature is my favourite.”

Violet nods and follows Harry away from the table and to the kitchen. A silence washes over them as they scrap leftovers from their plates into the bin. Violet watches his every move. She felt like she was on the verge of breaking something every two minutes, so maybe if she followed him around she wouldn’t.

As the pair were maneuvering around the small (large?) space, she couldn’t help but notice the stark differences between their homes. Violet’s parents’ kitchen had a small bay window over the split sink. Her mum had these tiny teal coloured curtains up for privacy and a tomato planter that had been on the windowpane for the past four years that Violet’s dad refuses to trash. They had an average white fridge, a dish drying rack on the side and a tiny two stool island in the centre. It was a very average kitchen. Chestnut cupboards and white laminate flooring. Violet liked their kitchen. But this kitchen…Violet loved this kitchen.

The dim ceiling lights gave off a soft, golden glow that complemented the modern palm leaf wallpaper covering half of the kitchen. She noticed that the knobs on the hob, the cupboard handles, and even the silverware have gold bits in them. It’s probably real. There were two iceboxes, both of them larger than Harry, had the same wood detail that was on the cupboards making them blend into the aesthetic of the room effortlessly. The second fridge, however, was see through and only contained drinks. Violet couldn’t help but look around the room in wonder. It was insane how beautiful just a kitchen could be.

“You comin’?”

Violet hears the amusement in Harry’s voice before she sees it in his face. She could feel her cheeks heat. “Sorry.”

He turns and she follows him, doing her best to avoid looking at anything except his back. She felt like it’s almost a bit disrespectful to peep around anymore. Even though she had been invited over, she felt that he’d had enough people trying to invade his life and she didn’t want to be one of them.

Harry snagged his laptop from the couch in the centre of the second family room before sitting in that same spot. He patted the cushion next to him and sent Violet a grin. “Alright, since everyone is so up my arse, you’ll be the judge of my music.”

“Finally, someone with taste,” Violet huffs before flopping down in the spot beside him. He lets out one loud laugh while clicking around on his MacBook.

“Okay,” he says, glancing at her briefly before looking back at his laptop, “the first song I’m gonna play for you here is Only Angel. It’s one of my favourites.”

“Mmkay.” Violet watches as he sticks a headphone splitter into the laptop. He hands her a pair of headphones and she pushes them into her ears. She genuinely hopes his music is good because she can’t fathom telling The Harry Styles his music is shit. Surely it isn’t though. He’s right, he has could a couple hundred thousand, probably a couple million, that love his voice so it can’t be a fluke.

The song starts and instantly Violet feels transcended. Was this a choir, was this him? Was this God? Okay, that’s a stretch, she knows, but already this piece sounded heavenly. Literally. There was such an ethereal, soft feel. Then,

Hey, hey!

Violet’s eyes widen in surprise and she leaned back in the couch a bit shocked. The song bursts into a very heavy 70s rock-influenced track. She did not see that coming. Harry was eating it up. Someone outside of his family, producers, and bandmates is listening to his music and is going to give him actual feedback.

Broke a finger knocking on your bedroom door

I got splinters in my knuckles crawling ‘cross the floor

Couldn’t take you home to mother in a skirt that short

But I think that’s what I like about it

 

She’s an angel.

 

Violet found herself almost frozen. This song was so…sensual. It sounded like Harry was no stranger to the casual one-night stand. Violet wouldn’t know, but from the way he’s singing about it, it sounds like a divine and celestial experience.

When the song finished Violet let out a huff of air. She was taken aback. She wasn’t expecting that. The Harry she listened to was maybe sixteen, seventeen and sang about first kisses. Because she hadn’t kept up with him like everyone else in their little village, she didn’t realise how much he’d grown up.

“Well,” he drags out. He’s been waiting for a response for a minute or two. He won’t admit it, but he hopes she likes it. Harry, since he first met her, found himself wanting to empress her.

“It’s…” she breaths heavily out of her mouth before turning to look Harry in the eye, “…yeah.”

Harry frowns. “Not your cup ‘o tea?”

“No,” she shouts, “I mean, yeah. It’s great. Its…it’s amazing. I’m just a bit shocked. This is the first time I’ve heard, like, any of your music since, what was that album, Midnight Memories.”

“So, you like it.” He says it as a statement and he’s grinning now. She’s kind of glad she was able to do that. “Recorded it in one take.”

“Yeah, Harry. It’s great. The contrast was amazing.”

He lets out a bit of a giggle and Violet’s heart swells. As he’s pulling up the next song, Violet is studying him. He’s got a mole by his lip and she reckons it’s the cutest thing she’s ever seen; besides the way he’s pinching his bottom lip in concentration. She shouldn’t be looking at him like this. Hasn’t he got some supermodel girlfriend?

“This next one, it means a lot to me. It took me a while to finish it, but I think I like it.”

Violet closes her eyes and lets her body relax into the sofa as the folk-rock tune surrounded her. Halfway through the song, she recognises that despite the upbeat tune, the lyrics are melancholy. She could sense some sort of disconnect and inability to move on.

Almost over, had enough from you

And I’ve been prayin’, I never did before

Understand I’m talkin’ to the walls

I’ve been prayin’ ever since New York.

 

Violet finds herself tearing up. She knows exactly who this is about.

She finds herself pulling the headphones off. She begins to wipe her eyes with the sleeve of her graphic t-shirt. Harry clicks pause and pulls his headphones out too.

“’S about Robin, isn’t it?”

Harry has a sharp intake of air before nodding and looking down at the screen. He suddenly wishes he didn’t play this song. “How’d you know?”

“Um, the first part, really, but the second confirmed it. Sounds like you’re talking to doctors or summat.” He looks at her with wonder in his eyes. She continues. “Tell me something, you don’t know nothin’ just pretend you do,” she reads from the computer screen. “Sounds like you’re talkin’ to doctors. And then choose your words cause there’s no antidote for this curse, oh, what’s it waiting for. Must this hurt you just before you go?” There’s a silence. The kind where they can hear each other breathing. “I just remember them coming in the shop all the time. Robin and your mum. Then they stopped coming. And then it was only her. Took a couple weeks, but she told me. I…I’m sorry for your loss.”

Harry nods sending her a small smile. “Thank you.”

“Thank you,” she retaliates, “for trusting me. And not think it’s weird that I know all the television shows you watched as a tot.”

Harry chuckles. “Reckon that’s mums fault there.” They laugh together.

Violet’s never felt like this before. This feeling of peace in someone’s presence that she hardly knew. She liked Harry. Maybe more than she should but that doesn’t matter right now. What matters now is the gold flakes sparkling in his eyes and the way his lips looked like her favourite watermelon candy floss. She wonders if his lips taste like watermelon candy floss too.

“Can I have yeh number?” 

She doesn’t hesitate when she takes her mobile out her back pocket. This causes her to shuffle a bit closer to him, their knees now touching. She lays it softly in his hand and he gives her his. Even their phones are different. The iPhone X felt so luxurious in her. She can only guess what he’s thinking about her 5S.

“Violet, honey,” Violet’s mum rounds the corner with her dad and Anne, “it’s getting late.”

“Okay.” Violet stands and hands Harry his phone back and vice versa. “It was nice meeting you, Harry.”

“Was nice meeting you too. Hopefully, I’ll see you again soon.”

Her heart flutters for the umpteenth time that night. She knows he knows what he’s doing to her surly. She decides to be cheeky and responds with, “you will.”

Anne and Harry see the family of three off and when Violet gets home she bids her parents good night and jogs to her room. She felt a smile on her face as she clambered into bed. And just as her head hit her pillow, just as her eyes shut and her breathing slowed, her phone buzzed. She picked it up, flinching at the harsh light. A smile stretched across her face when she read the text. She didn’t know where this was going, but she didn’t mind where it was at now.

Rockstar H: lunch tomorrow? :)

trail.content_abstract:
Thank you all so much for liking and reblogging and following. I didn’t expect feedback so fast. That really does motivate me to work harder. I’m currently working on an imagine and another series already lol so I hope you guys enjoy. Links to the series and my masterlist is at the bottom of the page!

 d x

Never Sometimes Always – Chapter Two

Violet actually didn’t want to go to Anne’s tonight.

Sure, she knows Anne and she’s friendly with her. She would even go as far as consider Anne a good friend. But that doesn’t change the fact that they are filthy rich and Violet virtually has nothing.

Really, it’s not that Violet thinks they’re stuck up. They are possibly the nicest people on Earth from what she’s gathered. It’s just…they seem to be in a different world than she’s in. It’s not like Violet didn’t take notice of the different variations of Prada bags Anne owned. Or the fact that her trainers were Gucci. It’s just very hard for her not to notice these things and Violet doesn’t want to go to their probably lavish house looking…poor.

body:
One Shot Harry Styles

  • Pedido -  Tay, esse será meu terceiro pedido aqui no tumblr, nem preciso dizer que eu amo sua escrita, você realmente manda muito bem! Bom, (antes de qualquer coisa, quero dizer que meu pedido foi inspirado no relacionamento da personagem Sophia de “GIRLBOSS”). Eu gostaria que você fizesse um com o H, que ele e a S/N tem um relacionamento ‘casual’, só que pra ela nunca foi tão 'casual’ assim. Dai, ela vai até a gravadora, onde ele tava gravando, encontrar com ele, só que se depara com a seguinte situação: uma das integrante da banda do H, está 'chupando ele’. Ela termina com ele. Se você já tiver assistido “girlboss” acredito que vai ser fácil, caso nunca assistiu, assista o ep 12, vai te ajudar. Desculpa se ficou confuso. Obrigada! ❤


﻿Tem coisas que você vê que te faz fechar os olhos, respirar fundo para só então abri-los novamente para ter certeza do que viu e eu fiz exatamente isso, infelizmente não era fruto da minha imaginação ou uma peça pregada pela minha insegurança.

Eu estive ocupada no último mês, sim eu admito, mas não pensei que esse tempo fosse o suficiente para perder uma pessoa. A quem eu quero enganar, eu sabia que era tempo suficiente para perder todas as pessoas possíveis, mas não pensei que eu fosse perdê-lo. Não, definitivamente quem me perdeu foi ele.

No momento que eu tive certeza do que meus olhos viam, eu lentamente levei minha mão ao bolso traseiro da minha calça - tão devagar quanto eu pude, talvez com medo deles notarem a minha presença a qualquer movimento brusco - desbloqueei a tela e meu dedo de forma ágil clicou sobre o aplicativo de câmera. Eu iria filmá-los, os pervertidos de plantão me agradeceriam por um pornô tão safado e natural, eles devem adorar uma vadia caindo de boca em um traidor.

Antes mesmo de começar a filmar, a maldita consciência me fez congelar, eu não podia fazer isso, mesmo que o sangue ferva em minhas veias e o sabor da vingança me deixe com água na boca, eu estaria sendo mais baixa do que aquele traidor e a vadia ajoelhada na frente dele. Engolindo o ódio crescendo no meu peito, eu apenas guardei o celular no bolso e dei as costas saindo daquele lugar antes que eu vomitasse.

Se querem um conselho, tomem cuidado com quem dorme ao seu lado. Ele ou ela, pode está te apunhalando pelas costas sem o menor remorso, digo isso porque o safado traidor está agora do meu lado roncando na minha cama.

Depois de clicar no enviar e esperar a postagem carregar no blog, eu fecho o meu notebook o deixando de lado sobre a minha escrivaninha, mais uma vez me viro para olhar Harry esparramado na minha cama e a imagem dele com a cabeça jogada para trás gemendo enquanto a vadia chupava o pau dele ate engasgar voltou a minha mente. Eu juro que estou lutando contra a vontade de pegar o travesseiro e matá-lo asfixiado.

Eu achei que o que tínhamos era mais forte do que uma vadia qualquer, eu estou errada em chamá-la de vadia, ela não me devia nada enquanto ele me devia pelo menos consideração, vê-lo dormir ao meu lado tranquilamente só me mostra que ele não tem um pingo de remorso.

No último mês eu passei completamente devotada a escrever o meu livro, estava empenhada a realizar o meu sonho de ter um conto completo escrito por mim e talvez até publicá-lo caso alguma editora goste, Harry sabia o quão importante era eu ter esse tempo só para mim, ele me apoiou, disse que me entendia perfeitamente porque ele sentia a mesma coisa pela música dele. Mentiroso, ele não me entendia coisa nenhuma.

Eu compreendi as noites que ele passou no estúdio gravando o álbum dele, eu dormi sozinha, o liguei toda noite para desejar boa noite e o recebia quando ele chegava. Na minha vez, quando eu ficava escrevendo no terraço do prédio até de madrugada e só ia para cama quando eu literalmente dormia sentada na frente do notebook, ele ainda tentava me fazer aceitar fazer sexo, talvez seja por isso que ele estava adorando aquela vadia, eu não estava dando o que ele queria.

A pergunta que não quer calar… Ele estava mesmo gravando o álbum todas as noites que ficou fora? Antes eu não tinha dúvida, agora eu não coloco minha mão no fogo por ele.

— Você não vai dormir? — a voz rouca entrou em meus ouvidos e só então percebi que eu estava o encarando igual uma psicopata.

— Estou sem sono… Muito café. — ou talvez sua imagem sendo chupado esteja me atormentando.

— Deite aqui, viciada. — ele bateu de leve no travesseiro ao seu lado.  O sorriso preguiçoso em seu rosto em outros tempos me faria sorrir também, mas no momento apenas não sei o que sentir então me deitei ao lado dele deixando que me cobrisse com a coberta felpuda.

— Você quer me contar o que fez hoje? Qual o progresso do seu livro? — seu corpo próximo ao meu me deixa ainda mais irritada, a mágoa crescendo por ele ser um mentiroso.

— Bloqueio criativo. — respondi simplesmente, se eu mantivesse minha boca aberta por tempo demais eu jogarei tudo na cara dele.

— Você está tão calada, geralmente você fala pelos cotovelos sobre o seu livro. — ele riu baixo.

— E você? O que fez hoje? Se divertiu no estúdio? Eu aposto que sim. — direcionei meu olhar em direção aos seus olhos e vi que ele ficou desconfortável.

— Nada demais, estamos compondo músicas novas.

— Geralmente você fala pelos cotovelos sobre seu trabalho no estúdio. — ok, eu estou fazendo joguinho, mas em minha defesa, eu só quero que ele me diga a verdade.

— Você está estranha hoje…

— Não é nada… Só estava andando por aí e dei de cara com um pornô vagabundo, daqueles mal feito e bem amador.

— Não sabia que você assistia esse tipo de coisa… — ele se mexeu e deitou de barriga para cima olhando para o teto.

— Eu não assisto, pode ter certeza, mas eu queria ver o quão fundo a vadia conseguia enfiar o pau do safado. Ela parecia ser tão experiente. — olhei bem fixamente seu rosto mudar de expressão.

— Precisa mesmo dar detalhes? — ele me olhou, sobrancelhas franzidas.

— Eu nem disse ainda que o cenário era um estúdio e que eu assisti ao vivo. — eu assistir seu rosto mudar de cor, ele realmente não esperava por essa.

— Você viu aquilo? (Seu nome), eu posso explicar! — ele se sentou de frente para mim tão rápido quanto falou a frase.

— Explicar? Eu não quero uma explicação. — bati em sua mão quando ele tentou me tocar e me sentei na cama.

— Não é nada do que você está pensando, aconteceu só essa vez. — quando eu ia me levantar da cama Harry segurou minha mão entre as suas — Por favor me escuta!

— Que diferença faz ser uma ou duas vezes? — olho seu rosto e não posso deixar de rir quando percebo que ele realmente acha que faz diferença — Eu poderia pensar no seu caso se você tivesse chegado nervoso me contando o que tinha feito. Você escondeu, então não pretendia me contar.

— Eu tive medo! — soltei minha mão das suas e ele levou-as até seu cabelo recém cortado — Eu gosto tanto de você, (seu nome).

— Não o suficiente para manter o pênis dentro da calça. — finalmente me levantei da cama e apontei para a porta do quarto — Vá embora!

— (Seu nome)…

— Vá, Harry! — isso já estava me irritando — Não torne as coisas piores, não faça eu detestar você. Amanhã você volta para pegar suas coisas.

Harry assentiu e levantou pegando sobre a poltrona no canto do quarto sua camisa, ele me olhou uma última vez antes de sair e eu virei o rosto não querendo ver sua cara de coitado, a culpa é toda dele.

Ouvi a porta da frente fechar e o apartamento pequeno pareceu tão grande agora que ele se foi, eu nem sei se ele tem para onde ir, já é de madrugada.

Pela primeira vez no dia me permiti chorar, deitada na minha cama com o travesseiro de Harry apertado entre meus braços.

-xXx-

No dia seguinte eu estava mais conformada, Harry não está aqui e eu vou superar como sempre supero as dificuldades da vida, a única questão agora é que eu não tenho vontade de sair da cama e não quero escrever a história de um personagem que Harry me ajudou a criar.

Por volta das seis da tarde a campainha tocou e eu já sabia quem era, então depois de olhar o que eu estava vestindo - uma camisa dele que me servia de pijama há muito tempo - respirei fundo e abri a porta o vendo escorado no batente com uma mão enquanto olhava para o chão, sua cabeça se ergueu com o barulho da porta e eu pude olhar em seus olhos.

Toda a vontade de chorar que eu achei que havia superado me atingiu em cheio novamente, apenas mordi meu lábio e fiz um gesto para que ele entrasse. A mochila grande cheia de roupa e o violão que o pertence no canto da sala para que ele pegue e saia.

— Nós podemos conversar? — Harry perguntou ao ver suas coisas já arrumadas — Por favor!

— Tudo bem. — fecho a porta e me encosto na mesma mantendo distância.

— Me perdoe, (seu nome)… — ele suspirou — Não estou pedindo para me deixar ficar ou continuar nosso namoro, estou pedindo para não cortar todos os laços. Por favor, eu sei que o que fiz foi errado, muito errado, e eu não sei onde estava com a cabeça mas eu não quero ficar sem falar com você, eu gosto tanto da pessoa que você é.

— Eu não esperava isso de você… Nunca… —as lágrimas que eu segurava desceram por meu rosto silenciosas e sorrateiras. Harry caminhou até mim e seus braços rodearam minha cintura em um abraço que eu correspondi apertando-o em meus braços — Eu te odeio tanto… Tanto, Harry. — afastei um pouco nossos corpos e deslizei meu nariz por sua bochecha levemente, segundos depois nossos lábios estavam colados em um selinho demorado. Mais lágrimas desceram quando me caiu a ficha que era o nosso beijo de adeus.

— Me perdoe… — ele sussurrou quando eu me afastei.

— Você precisa ir.

Assisti Harry pegar suas coisas e vim até onde eu estava beijar minha testa antes de deixar o apartamento que antes era nosso, agora eu estou sozinha com as lágrimas secando em meu rosto. Terminar meu livro é minha única preocupação depois que ouvi o barulho da porta fechar encerrando um capítulo da minha vida.


♡

♡


Eu espero que tenham gostado. ♡

Esse é o último pedido do cronograma e mais uma vez me perdoem por demorar tanto para entregá-los.

 - Tay
